autumn.util

Class Strings

  • java.lang.Object
    • autumn.util.Strings

  • public final class Strings
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides static utility methods for working with strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Strings()

    • Method Detail

      • escape

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.CharSequence string)
        This method replaces escape-sequences in a string with the characters they represent.
        Parameters:
        string - the string that may contain escape-sequences.
        Returns:
        the modified string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if string is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an escape-sequence is malformed.

      • unescape

        public static java.lang.String unescape(java.lang.CharSequence string)
        This method replaces escapable characters with escape-sequences.
        Parameters:
        string - is the string to un-escape.
        Returns:
        the string with escapable characters replaced with escape-sequences.

      • padStart

        public static java.lang.String padStart(java.lang.CharSequence string,
                        char character,
                        int length)
        This method pads the start of a string.
        Parameters:
        string - is the string to pad.
        character - is the padding character.
        length - is the required minimum length of the string.
        Returns:
        the padded string.

      • padEnd

        public static java.lang.String padEnd(java.lang.CharSequence string,
                      char character,
                      int length)
        This method pads the end of a string.
        Parameters:
        string - is the string to pad.
        character - is the padding character.
        length - is the required minimum length of the string.
        Returns:
        the padded string.

      • zfill

        public static java.lang.String zfill(java.lang.CharSequence string,
                     int length)
        This method pads the beginning of a string with zeros, if needed.
        Parameters:
        string - is the string to possibly pad.
        length - is the desired minimum length of the result.
        Returns:
        the padded string.

      • repeat

        public static java.lang.String repeat(java.lang.CharSequence string,
                      int times)
        This method creates a string that is another string repeated zero or more times.
        Parameters:
        string - is the string to repeat.
        times - is the number of times to repeat the string.
        Returns:
        the aforedescribed string.

      • str

        public static java.lang.String str(java.lang.Object value)
        This method creates the string representation of a value.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value itself.
        Returns:
        value.toString(), if the value is not null; otherwise return "null".

      • str

        public static java.lang.String str(java.lang.Iterable<?> iterable,
                   java.lang.String prefix,
                   java.lang.String separator,
                   java.lang.String suffix)
        This method creates a string representation for an iterable.
        Parameters:
        iterable - is the iterable itself.
        prefix - is a string to prepend onto the result.
        separator - is the substring used to separate elements in the result.
        suffix - is a string to append onto the result.
        Returns:
        the aforedescribed result.

      • longestCommonSubstring

        public static java.lang.String longestCommonSubstring(java.lang.CharSequence string1,
                                      java.lang.CharSequence string2)
        This method finds the longest-common-substring in two strings.
        Parameters:
        string1 - is the first string.
        string2 - is the second string.
        Returns:
        the longest-common-substring in the two strings.

      • isNullOrEmpty

        public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.CharSequence string)
        This method determines whether a string value is either null or the empty string.
        Parameters:
        string - is the value to check.
        Returns:
        true, iff the argument is null or the empty string.

      • commonPrefix

        public static java.lang.String commonPrefix(java.lang.CharSequence string1,
                            java.lang.CharSequence string2)
        This method finds the common prefix of two strings.
        Parameters:
        string1 - is the first string.
        string2 - is the second string.
        Returns:
        the prefix that string1 and string2 share.

      • commonSuffix

        public static java.lang.String commonSuffix(java.lang.CharSequence string1,
                            java.lang.CharSequence string2)
        This method finds the common suffix of two strings.
        Parameters:
        string1 - is the first string.
        string2 - is the second string.
        Returns:
        the suffix that string1 and string2 share.

      • levenshteinDistance

        public static int levenshteinDistance(java.lang.String string1,
                      java.lang.String string2)
        This method computes the Levenshtein distance between two strings.

        This is a string similarity algorithm. The more similar the two strings are, the lower the Levenshtein distance.

        Parameters:
        string1 - is the first string.
        string2 - is the second string.
        Returns:
        the Levenshtein distance between the two strings.
